DOC.brief_title: Escitalopram Mood Stabilizer Bipolar II Disorder
DOC.detailed_description: This study randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled , cross-over trial Escitalopram ( 10 mg ) versus placebo ( identical presentation ) subject identify Bipolar II Disorder . The nine-month study commence no-treatment baseline period three month ( Baseline Phase ) ensure subject meet criterion episode frequency . Subjects compliant complete baseline period requirement randomize receive Escitalopram placebo three month ( Phase 2 ) subsequently cross receive alternative compound final three-month period ( Phase 3 ) . Prior cross-over , two-day taper period avoid potential withdrawal effect , follow seven-day wash-out period avoid carry-over effect drug placebo . Subjects assess start study , every month thereafter entire nine-month period . Subjects age 18-65 meeting diagnostic criterion Bipolar II disorder recruit . Diagnosis base Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders exception minimum four-day duration criterion hypomanic episode . Subjects must minimum 2-year history depressive hypomanic episode , mood disturbance ( either ‘ high ’ ‘ low ’ ) occur least monthly . Subjects exclude previously treat anti-depressants mood-stabilisers , history psychotic symptom episode either hypomania depression . Subjects actively suicidal , significant personality disorder , substantive illicit drug use , alcohol consumption > 30g/day also exclude . Exclusion also apply subject pregnant breastfeeding , history heart disease , liver disease , epilepsy seizure . Subjects complete number self-report questionnaire mood function monthly basis well monitoring mood daily basis . A research psychologist psychiatrist complete ( monthly interval ) Hamilton Depression Rating , Young Mania Rating Scale DSM-IV Social Occupational Functioning Assessment Scale base function previous week throughout nine-month duration study .
